dialogues.text: Amy rushes to the subway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy swipes her card goes through turn styles.  121.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The subway car stops. A collective groan from the strange

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Why are we stopped?

dialogues.speaker: ANGRY SUBWAY PATRON
dialogues.text: You know sometimes on these short trains you know it doesn’t touch that third rail where the electricity is and that red light comes on and the power just shuts off.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: ANGRY SUBWAY PATRON
dialogues.text: No, I don’t fucking know. Do I look like I work for MTA?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: ANGRY SUBWAY PATRON
dialogues.text: I got MetroCards in my fucking purse now? What the fuck man? You ask me some stupid shit.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: JOSTLED SUBWAY PATRON
dialogues.text: Don’t lean into me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Knicks game in progress.

dialogues.speaker: MARV ALBERT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Pierce off the drive, it is blocked by Stoudamire. And he comes up with the ball. Under four to play here in the first. Smith finding Stoudamire. That gets the crowd going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy runs into the Garden.  122.

dialogues.speaker: ALDEN
dialogues.text: Hey Dr. Conners.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: ALDEN
dialogues.text: Amar’e looked good tonight.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Yeah I’m happy for him.

dialogues.speaker: ALDEN
dialogues.text: Actually he’s looking for you. He said to meet you on court.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: On court? Right now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The garden is empty. Aaron walks out. Music starts. The Knicks City Dancers come out. Amy is among them, in the outfit, dancing.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Amy? Amy attempts to keep up with the steps, she struggles, bu giving it her all. At a music change it gets very street. gets very into it. Aaron claps and smiles. Another music change. She does the dance and is kind of nailing it. Aaron calls Amy over to him. AARON (CONT’D) Come here.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: No, I’m sorry. And you are really, really good.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: As it turns out I am in terrible physical shape.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: I saw that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you see that? I am sweating more than I am proud of.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Hey, I really missed you.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I missed you. They kiss. Music change.

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh shit I have to dance more.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: What? Amy you really don’t need to do that. 123. The acrobatic dunkers from the Slam Dunk Contest appear. AARON (CONT’D) Why’s there a mat? Oh shit these guys. Amy appears with a basketball. AARON (CONT’D) No. Amy. Bad idea. Cut it. No. Amy starts running for the trampoline in slow motion. Amy takes off, hits the trampoline to dunk, but falls flat on face. The music stops. Aaron runs over. AARON (CONT’D) Amy. Amy. You ok?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Did I get it?

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Did you get the basket?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Did it go in?

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Oh of course not. You didn’t get enough height.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I thought I got a lot of height.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: No height. Usually when people hit trampolines they go high, but for some reason you just went down. You went straight down.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I really wanted to impress you. I wanted to show you I can work hard and put myself out there.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: I got that.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: And not be afraid to fail.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: No, I got the metaphor.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Cause with the dance I wanted to show you us. Cause I want to try with you. Aaron is very touched.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: I want to try too.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I love you.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: I love you too Amy. They kiss. The Knicks City Dancers cheer. We pull out and see that they are on the JumboTron. They smile and make out as the music plays.
